title: Popular child actor Omkar Kapoor is nervous for his dream debut
text: Deccan Chronicle | Rohit Bhatnagar | October 01, 2015, 19.00 pm Mumbai: After making appearances in films like 'Ghoonghat', 'Masoom', 'Judaai' as a child actor, Omkar Kapoor is back with a bang with ‘Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2’ opposite Ishita Sharma. In a conversation, Omkar talks about his nervousness and his struggle to bag a part in ‘Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2’. Omkar Kapoor did several known films like 'Judwaa', 'Hero No.1', 'Mela' as a child actor but he feels 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2’ is the best debut for his career. When asked about the film, he said, “I was slightly nervous in the beginning but I thought that I have to live up to the expectations. In fact, I also had a small ragging session initially but later it was fun working with the team.” Not many know that Omkar had also assisted pioneering directors like Sanjay Leela Bhansali, Farah Khan and Ahmed Khan, but he really wanted to be an actor and hence gave many auditions, of which he bagged ‘Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2’. When asked about his first break, he replied, “I am not burdened as such I think I have to surprise the audience and break the norm of cliched Bollywood romantic roles.
